meanings.definition: The quality or state of being stern.
meanings.sent1: Her sternness in class made the students behave.
meanings.sent2: His father's sternness was balanced by his mother's warmth.
meanings.sent3: The sternness of the librarian made the children giggle nervously.
meanings.sent4: The sternness of the judge's gaze left no room for doubt.
meanings.sent5: The sternness of the storm clouds warned of an impending downpour.

meanings.sent1: The teacher's sternness surprised the misbehaving student.
meanings.sent2: His sternness towards discipline was well-known among his colleagues.
meanings.sent3: The sternness of the chef's instructions made the kitchen staff work faster.
meanings.sent4: The sternness of the warning sign made hikers cautious of the cliff edge.
meanings.sent5: The sternness of the traffic officer's voice made drivers stop immediately.

meanings.sent1: The general's sternness was evident in his every command.
meanings.sent2: Her sternness in negotiations often led to successful deals.
meanings.sent3: The sternness of the security guard's expression softened when he saw the lost child.
meanings.sent4: The sternness of the mountain's peak deterred many climbers.
meanings.sent5: The sternness of the old oak tree's branches gave it a majestic appearance.
